subject: Re: [junit] Problems migrating from JUnit3.7 to 3.8.1
msgSnippet: ... Nope.  I use them with JDK 1.4 all the time (and JDK 1.4.1) -- They that give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither
messageBody:
Paul Michali wrote:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
>
>>As the NoSuchMethodError is coming from an Ant class, I would say you
>>need to update Ant.
>
>
> That was it. Thanks! I didn't see anything where JUnit3.8.1 said that
> it needed Ant1.5 or newer. I must have missed it.
>
> Is there any advantage/disadvantage to moving to JDK1.4 with these
> versions of Ant and JUnit?


Nope. I use them with JDK 1.4 all the time (and JDK 1.4.1)


--

"They that give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety."
- Benjamin Franklin
